Portfolio

Check out some of my projects...
C# / Unity

Unity MIDI File Reader

The aim of this project was to develop a package file for the Unity game engine that would give developers the ability to utilise data embedded in MIDI files to trigger game events. Programs that allow for the creation and editing of MIDI files, make it easy for users to synchronise events with musical rhythms. Therefore, when utilised in games, MIDI data can make the development of rhythm games like Guitar Hero and Dance Dance Revolution much easier by triggering events to spawn game objects, like the interactable notes for example, in sync with a musical track playing in the background.

View Details View Github
C++ / C# / JUCE Framework

Unity Synth

This project was designed to explore the capabilities of .dll plugins written in C++ for Unity's audio engine. A subtractive synthesiser and simple reverb and delay effects were developed in the JUCE framework and exported into an appropriate format to include onto one of Unity's mixer channels. A small application was developed to showcase this. Simple solar systems are randomly generated, then when the user clicks on each planet or moon, note events are sent to the synthesiser in order to generate audio. A menu was also implemented that allows users to change parameters of the synthesiser and effects showcasing the real time, procedurally generated audio.

View Details View Github
C++ / Arduino / MaxMSP

Max Control Event

Max Control was an event featuring several experimental musical performances that each utilised technology in a different way. My contribution to the event was to create a reactive lighting system in order to add visuals to each performers output. This was done by using several digital LED strips that could be programmed through an arduino module.
